item.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).
After replacing the fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE

test1.ptxt: Check the injector compensation code.
Click here

entry.ptxt: Compensation codes of the installed injector assemblies are the same as the compensation codes registered in the ECM

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation codes.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING IDLING AND 4000 RPM (PROCEDURE 3)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Common Rail (All).
Take a snapshot of the following Data List items.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting. The data in the list below is that of a normal vehicle, but as the data varies between individual vehicles, this data should only be used for reference.
Check the Data List at idling and at 4000 rpm with no load after the engine is warmed up.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8 AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 and Injection Volume in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was idling and at 4000 rpm with no load.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than 3.0 mm3/st
Injection Volume is less than 5.5 mm3/st at 3000 rpm

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st (-3.0 mm3/st is the lowest normal value), as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the injector assemblies are not malfunctioning.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CHECK THE CYLINDER COMPRESSION)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to help determine whether a cylinder has compression loss or not.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Check the Cylinder Compression / Data List / Compression / Engine Speed of Cyl #1 to #8.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Check the engine speed during the Active Test.

entry.ptxt: The values of Engine Speed Cyl #1 to #8 are within 10 rpm of each other.

atten4.ptxt: When cranking, if the speed of a cylinder is approximately 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, there is probably a complete loss of compression in that cylinder.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK CYLINDER COMPRESSION PRESSURE

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When compression is low, there may be cracks in the piston or the fuel injector may be installed improperly.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the values.

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off, the engine coolant temperature should be 75°C (167°F) or more and the engine should be idled for 1 minute or more.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than 3.0 mm3/st

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injecyor due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injecyor, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st (-3.0 mm3/st is the lowest normal value), as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the injector assemblies are not malfunctioning.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AND REPLACE PARTIAL ENGINE ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Check and replace the engine assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (TEST THE FUEL LEAK)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak / Data List / Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.
Take a snapshot with the GTS during the Active Test.
Measure the difference between the target fuel pressure (Target Common Rail Pressure) and the actual fuel pressure (Common Rail Pressure) when the "Test the Fuel Leak" Active Test is performed.

atten4.ptxt: In order to obtain an exact measurement, perform the Active Test 5 times and measure the difference once each time the Active Test is performed.

specitem.ptxt: The difference between the target fuel pressure and the actual fuel pressure 2 seconds after the Active Test starts is less than 10000 kPa (102.0 kgf/cm2, 1451 psi).

atten3.ptxt: *: Even when the results of the Active Test are normal, take a snapshot of vehicle data when the vehicle is accelerating. If "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure", proceed to step 12.
If "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure", the fuel filter may be clogged.

item.ptxt: "Target Common Rail Pressure" means target fuel pressure controlled by the ECM.
"Common Rail Pressure" means actual fuel pressure in common rail assembly.

If the pressure discharge valve mounted on the common rail assembly is malfunctioning, the actual fuel pressure may change as indicated by "Pressure Discharge Valve Abnormal Common Rail Pressure" in the illustration.
The pressure discharge valve operates to discharge fuel pressure when the internal pressure of the common rail exceeds the target fuel pressure.

There are 2 fuel pressure sensor circuits and both of them display the same value. If the difference between Common Rail Pressure exceeds 10000 kPa (102 kgf/cm2, 1451 psi) for 2 seconds or more, it is necessary to inspect or repair the wiring for the fuel pressure sensor.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT COMMON RAIL ASSEMBLY (PRESSURE DISCHARGE VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / Pressure Discharge Valve Check.
Click here
Select "Always Closed Check".
Press "Next".
Read the Value of fuel pressure values.

item.ptxt: If the fuel pressure cannot be maintained, the pressure discharge valve may not have a tight seal.

If the fuel pressure is being properly maintained, there are no problems with the sealing properties of the high-pressure fuel system. Therefore, an insufficient supply of fuel due to the fuel filter being clogged, or squashed or blocked low-pressure fuel pipes or hoses may be causing the reduction in the common rail pressure.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT CLOGGED FUEL PIPE

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Target Common Rail Pressure and Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: With no load after the engine is warmed up, take a snapshot when idling and vehicle was accelerating with the accelerator pedal fully depressed in 2nd gear.
Check the Target Common Rail Pressure and Common Rail Pressure value.

entry.ptxt: While idling the vehicle, "Common Rail Pressure" deviates from the normal range and varies periodically with a period of approximately 2 seconds or more*1
"Common Rail Pressure" is normal while idling the vehicle, but "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear*2

item.ptxt: *1: The cause may be a squashed or blocked fuel pipe or hose.
*2: The cause may be a clogged fuel filter element assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE CLOGGED FUEL LINE

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the clogged (including frozen fuel) fuel pipe.
Replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: If "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear, replace the fuel filter element assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
REPLACE COMMON RAIL ASSEMBLY (PRESSURE DISCHARGE VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the common rail assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (COMMON RAIL PRESSURE AND TARGET COMMON RAIL PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Check Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Difference between Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure is 5000 kPa (51.0 kgf/cm2, 725 psi) or more

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Volume in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Injection Volume while idling after engine warm up is more than 10 mm3/st

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE INJECTOR ASSEMBLIES OF ALL CYLINDERS

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injectors of all cylinders.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the No. 1 injection pipe sub-assembly, No. 2 injection pipe sub-assembly and No. 1 nozzle leakage pipe assembly, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe sub-assembly may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation codes.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here
